conclusion: Problem involves shadows of four objects labeled A, B, C, and D with a light source above them.
Need to determine changes in position and size of shadows when light source moves downward.
Understanding shadows: formed when an object blocks light, creating a dark area behind it.
Size and position of shadow depend on position of light source and object.
If light source moves downward, shadows should become longer due to steeper angle.
Shadows should extend further from the objects as light source moves downward.
A is the shadow of a hand-shaped object.
Shadow A should shift and become longer, extending more away from the object.
B is the shadow of a person standing next to a plate with a pink substance.
Shadow B should become longer and possibly change position slightly.
C seems to be the shadow cast by the person's head or another object.
Shadow C should lengthen as the light source moves downward.
D is the shadow of a roll of tape.
Shadow D should become longer with the light source moving downward.
Shadows should consistently lengthen without changing direction if light source moves directly downward.
Shadows should move away from the objects, extending further onto the floor.
If shadows are overlapping, combined shadow areas might change in complexity.
